statements.name: PROC ERCOMPSTORE
statements.description: The ERCOMPSTORE procedure initializes the compound store from user-defined element, compound, and entity types. Element types represent the base variables and should correspond to variables from the input document tables. Compound types are defined on the basis of collections of element types, and entity types are defined on the basis of collections of compound types. The definitions that you specify in PROC ERCOMPSTORE persist with the compound store for the life of the compound store. So you need to run this procedure only once.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTIDTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of document ID to use in the raw import tables when you add documents.

arguments.name: PRESERVEDOCCASE
arguments.description: converts the document type to uppercase when you add documents.

arguments.name: RECORDIDTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of record ID to use in the raw import tables when you add documents.

statements.name: COMPOUNDSTORE
statements.description: The COMPOUNDSTORE statement enables you to specify the tables to use for the compound store.

arguments.name: COMPOUNDTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store compounds.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store documents.

arguments.name: ENTITYTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store entities.

arguments.name: LOCKTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table to use for preventing access to the compound store by other sessions while a procedure is running.

arguments.name: METADATATABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store the metadata, including the element, compound, and entity definitions.

statements.name: COMPOUNDTYPE
statements.description: The COMPOUNDTYPE statement enables you to define a compound type to use for entity resolution. A compound type is a collection of element types.

arguments.name: ELEMENTTYPES=
arguments.description: specifies the collection of element types that form this compound type.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the compound type. A compound type is a collection of element types and is used to define entity types.

arguments.name: MAXCOUNT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of times that a compound value of this type can appear in the data before the compound value is excluded.

arguments.name: MAXELEMENTTYPECOUNTS=
arguments.description: specifies a collection of element types and counts for defining compound exclusions. A compound value is excluded if the total number of distinct element values of the type that you specify in the ELEMENTTYPE= suboption is greater than the value that you specify in the MAXCOUNT= suboption.

statements.name: ELEMENTTYPE
statements.description: The ELEMENTTYPE statement enables you to define an element type to use for entity resolution. An element type represents a variable in a data table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the name of an element to be used to define compounds. This name must match a column name in a raw import table when you add documents.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS format to use when the element’s value is included in the output table.

arguments.name: ISATTRIBUTE
arguments.description: uses the element as an attribute for soft-deletions of documents and entities.

arguments.name: KEEP
arguments.description: includes this element’s value in the output table. This option applies only to elements in the primary element table.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of the element.

arguments.name: VALIDTIME=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use this element as a time value and, if so, whether the element’s value represents a starting time or an ending time when an entity is valid.

statements.name: ENTITYTYPE
statements.description: The ENTITYTYPE statement enables you to define an entity type to use for entity resolution. An entity type is a collection of compound types and a primary element type.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the entity definition.

arguments.name: COMPOUNDTYPES=
arguments.description: specifies one or more compound types to be used to define an entity. The strings must be unique to an ENTITYTYPE statement; they cannot be shared among different ENTITYTYPE statements.

arguments.name: PRIMARYELEMENTTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the element that defines the primary table when you add documents.

arguments.name: VALIDFROM=
arguments.description: specifies the element that defines the starting time when the entity is valid.

arguments.name: VALIDTO=
arguments.description: specifies the element that defines the ending time when the entity is valid.
